newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS WEEK LARGELY FIRMER.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS WEEK LARGELY FIRMER.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed on Friday firmer against most hard units and dealers said it could have appreciated further on the key U.S. dollar had the central bank not intervened in the market to mop up excess foreign currency.
"We saw the dollar appreciate to 11.2850/2950 before the central bank intervened," one dealer said, adding: "They could never justify an appreciating Zimbabwe dollar against rising inflation."
Annual inflation was pegged at 22.4 percent in April compared to 19.9 percent in March.

On Friday, the local unit closed at 11.2900/3000 on the U.S. dollar compared to Thursday's 11.2950/3050 and was at 18.4150/4450 against sterling, weakening from 18.3750/4025 earlier in the day, but still stronger against Thursday's 18.4800/5300.
It was also quoted firmer versus the rand at 2.5200/5250 compared to 2.5300/5400 but softened against the mark to 6.6760/6800 from 6.6700/6900.
